author: Yerevantsi
review_preview: I had the octopus and prawn with local red wine, and local dried meat. All perfect. Good service too. Highly recommended.
review_full: I had the octopus and prawn with local red wine, and local dried meat. All perfect. Good service too. Highly recommended.

author: kevfrombev
review_preview: I have worked in Ferrol on numerous occasions, and while there i always visit Abaco. It is a great place to eat and drink, and the tapas are excellent. The staff are friendly and polite and work very hard. This is a very popular bar...
review_full: I have worked in Ferrol on numerous occasions, and while there i always visit Abaco. It is a great place to eat and drink, and the tapas are excellent. The staff are friendly and polite and work very hard. This is a very popular bar and is always busy. Looking forward to my next visit!

author: AlanDublinIreland
title_review: Excellent bar for food and drink
review_preview: This tapas bar was recommended to us by our hotel and did not disappoint. We were a group of 11 and we were looked after very well by the helpful and polite staff. The design of bar is old style with separate cubicles and an...
review_full: This tapas bar was recommended to us by our hotel and did not disappoint. We were a group of 11 and we were looked after very well by the helpful and polite staff. The design of bar is old style with separate cubicles and an open area. We were given a selection of tapas with our drinks before meal and they were delicious. There is one menu in English which offers a range of food from fish to meat. We ere all very happy with the food and enjoyed 3 courses with plenty of wine for about 20 euros each (including tip). We arrived there around 6.30 pm and it was busy with a lot of locals present. There was a lively atmosphere which indicated that it is popular with the locals of Ferrol.

author: diogoborges
review_preview: good food, unassuming restaurant, good for couples and family. had a variety of tapas and most of them delivered
review_full: good food, unassuming restaurant, good for couples and family. had a variety of tapas and most of them delivered

author: 552mariaq
review_preview: Nice food, superb cheese, with friendly waiters. We were sorry that they don’t serve food outside. The deco could be better, in such a place that feels like it’s from a 90’s movie.
review_full: Nice food, superb cheese, with friendly waiters. We were sorry that they don’t serve food outside. The deco could be better, in such a place that feels like it’s from a 90’s movie.

author: cote60
review_preview: Had a fantastic coffee at Vanessa, this place is a bakery with an excellent choice of pastries both sweet and savoury, their Mille feuille look like works  of art.Traditional service with a smile.
review_full: Had a fantastic coffee at Vanessa, this place is a bakery with an excellent choice of pastries both sweet and savoury, their Mille feuille look like works  of art.Traditional service with a smile.

author: Kristal C
review_preview: My friends and me went to this place because it was highly recommended. The food was beautiful but the waiter called "Ruben" was absolutely rud. We could not understand something in the menu,so we asked him what was it and his answer was " why...
review_full: My friends and me went to this place because it was highly recommended. The food was beautiful but the waiter called "Ruben" was absolutely rud.  We could not understand something in the menu,so we asked him what was it and his answer was " why do you want me to explain it to you if you won't understand anyway?" We all were in shocked how rud he was with us. Also he had a bit of alcohol up to his head because the smell of his breath was full of alcohol. Another thing was that we wanted to order more food and his answer was " No! It is a lot of food"  WTF? If we want to order all the food in the menu it is our problem. At the end, we were going to eat it and pay for it. Anyway! The food was great but the service was teeeeerribleeee with this guy!

author: TravelerNYNy
title_review: Surprising and unexpected... BUT highly recommended!
review_preview: Ok. When my friend asked me how brave I was feeling that night I thought to myself... "Brave?" "In Ferrol?" "You have to be kidding me!!!". We all know each other. We all know EVERYTHING that is going on! Despite my initial reaction, I decided...
review_full: Ok. When my friend asked me how brave I was feeling that night I thought to myself... "Brave?" "In Ferrol?" "You have to be kidding me!!!". We all know each other. We all know EVERYTHING that is going on! Despite my initial reaction, I decided to let my friend decide where we would be dining that night... The car stopped in front of Vanessa. "Here???" I could not believe it! Vanessa is one of those places from the 90s where we used to have ice cream during lazy-Sunday afternoons...  Oh boy was I wrong... Dinner started with a small un-promising printed menu. There were approximately 20 small plates ranging from 2 to 10 euros. We ordered almost everything. Soon enough we realized that the chef (and yes, I call him chef), did not match the décor: it was a succulent succession of small delicacies, retaining the usual "tapas" style with a twist... The presentation of the tiny plates which, as bombs of flavor were landing at our table, was imaginative and tasteful. It is a tapas place, after all, but he was able to give delicacy to dishes as popular as cheese and anchovies...  I left the place longing for more... Since then, I have visited Vanessa in two more occasions. Each time, I had a pleasant, accommodating experience. I have not met the chef in person yet but, from here, I can only say that he is what a restaurant needs: commitment, enthusiasm, candor and sensibility. All these over a plate of bravas.  Please do not miss. I give it 4 stars because of the décor, however, maybe, that is what makes this place so fascinating... I do not know...

author: blopdon
title_review: Simple yet original cooking with the very best ingredients
review_preview: A friend took me to El Refugio a while ago and I have been there a number of times since. It is not the easiest restaurant to find and the location is not exactly picturesque or even touristic, but the experience is well worth the...
review_full: A friend took me to El Refugio a while ago and I have been there a number of times since. It is not the easiest restaurant to find and the location is not exactly picturesque or even touristic, but the experience is well worth the trip. The food, all local, is amazingly fresh; with some of the fish captured on the day by the cook´s husband. The cuisine is simple but far from boring because top quality ingredients are cooked with sensibility. The service is very friendly, knowledgeable and impeccably polite. The wine menu is extensive, with very interesting options. A meal not to be rushed. Pricier than other local eateries but definitely very good value for money because of quality and service.

author: Fiona W
review_preview: We visited here with a group of friends and had quite a variety of different tapas dishes, all beautifully presented and each delicate and well thought out. Recommended.
review_full: We visited here with a group of friends and had quite a variety of different tapas dishes, all beautifully presented and each delicate and well thought out. Recommended.

author: BrianMeit
review_preview: Really nice friendly bar/restaurant with a decent selection of tapas and rations. We had a very tasty shark steak, I would really recommend it. As well as fried squid. Meekly worth the visit.
review_full: Really nice friendly bar/restaurant with a decent selection of tapas and rations. We had a very tasty shark steak, I would really recommend it. As well as fried squid. Meekly worth the visit.

author: pboado
review_preview: You can't go wrong in a tapas bar in Galicia, can you? Well... you can. Pretentious concept: just a regular tapas bar (with a twist, but nothing that I haven't seen before) charging for 'tapas' double the price I've paid in central London. Food quality...
review_full: You can't go wrong in a tapas bar in Galicia, can you? Well... you can.  Pretentious concept: just a regular tapas bar (with a twist, but nothing that I haven't seen before) charging for 'tapas' double the price I've paid in central London.  Food quality is correct, some tapas are good but portion size/price relation is so poor that it stops you from enjoying your meal.  I'd say they claim too much of an almost nonexistent oriental influence in their dishes. We tried their tonkatsu (not a big japanese influence here, 7€ and a fancy name for a breaded cutlet ), 'churraskoreano' ( word game that suggests a korean influence, it was four small pieces of pressed boneless pork rib meat over coleslaw for 12€) , patatas bravas ( 4.50€ for a really small portion) , raxo ( 12€ , pretty small also ) , etc..  Service is correct for a bar, but far from having restaurant quality. It was summer and the weather was nice so we decided to have dinner on their patio ( that and not having available tables inside, but that's not their fault ) . It was a few tables in a back alley, not particularly good illuminated ( sorry about the photo quality ) .  We paid 80 euros in food for 5 people and all of us left the bar hungry , not looking forward to coming back again.

author: Alan S
review_preview: Small modern restaurant on the hill, connecting two streets. We were just in for a quick bite and would have come back the next day if it was open, which it wasn’t. We inquired about an English menu which the waitress said there wasn’t, but...
review_full: Small modern restaurant on the hill, connecting two streets. We were just in for a quick bite and would have come back the next day if it was open, which it wasn’t. We inquired about an English menu which the waitress said there wasn’t, but she would translate, which she did very well. We had a couple of nice plates and a good bottle of wine and left happy. Worth a visit.

author: alejandrop106
review_full: Local muy recomendable para tomar en Ferrol un buen vino con unas buenas tapas de acompañamiento. Los bocatas de calamares y lacón, mis preferidos. Para mí sublimes. El servicio, inmejorable.

author: Isabel B
review_full: Nos atendieron muy bien. Tomamos una cervezas con amigos en la terraza. De los pocos locales de Ferrol dónde te ponen una tapa con la bebida. El vino Godello exquisito.

author: 14javic
review_full: Local agradable y con buen ambiente. Tomamos unas cañas a mediodia los 5 amigos que ibamos, al final decidimos probar la carta y tambien hacer caso de alguna sugerencia del personal d ela Taberna. Buena comida y cantidades correctas! A todo ello podemos sumar que fue a un precio razonable y nada elevado. Lo recomiendo 100% tanto por su servicio y tapas como por su interesante carta.

author: Jose baltasar P
review_full: un desastre total,fui 2 veces , no tienen casi nada de la carta, la fritura brilla por su ausencia, echan a los clientes de la terraza, dicen que esta el aforo completo, y tienen las mesas sin recoger,,,bueno ,,no sigo

author: Isa C
review_full: Encontramos este sitio de casualidad y acertamos, buen Pincho con su consumición.Tienen unos bocatas buenísimos, una camarera súper agradable. Lo recomiendo.

author: Disfrutacontodo
review_full: La comida es estupenda, la atención maravillosa, el precio genial....y la música súper chula Un lugar para repetir!!! Sin duda volveremos!!

author: Journey23837479876
review_full: Estuve en una cata de vinos q organizaron, estuvo genial, aprendí un montón de cosas y cenamos de maravilla. Muy buena experiencia

author: PaPa_PiRuCo
review_full: Probamos su "pincho ilustrado" comida típica del siglo XVIII a base de patata, jamón, pisto y vino y quedamos encantados. Que decir de la atención y del local, de diez todo, volveré cada vez que vuelva a Ferrol. No os quedéis sin probar el bocata de carne kraken, de lo mejor.

author: 123rubenl
review_full: El local es muy agradable y la gente muy simpática y atenta. Están pendientes de todos los detalles y de que te sientas cómodo. La comida es de alto nivel, recomiendo los crujientes en diferentes texturas con sus salsas caseras. Se nota que se usan productos de la zona y de buena calidad. Los bocadillos son todos exquisitos, os recomiendo probar el de carne picada. No os arrepentiréis de ir a este lugar si estáis en Ferrol.

author: MiniOnTourES
review_full: Un sitio estupendo para parar en Ferrol, ya sea para tomar una cerveza bien fresquita o degustar sus raciones, tapas o pinchos ilustrados. Todo con un toque único y secreto, como por ejemplo la maceración de su carne o los ingredientes de algunas de sus salsas. Tiene una terraza estupenda y un personal encantador. ¡Nos sentimos como en casa! Si volvemos por Ferrol repetiremos seguro.

author: Guisanotti
title_review: A perfect traditional and charming place in the heart of the city.
review_preview: Totally recommend. Located in the center of Ferrol, this is a very traditional and really charming place. Packed with locals having a meal or just a glass of wine at the bar. The prices are low and the quality high, with very friendly and helpful...
review_full: Totally recommend. Located in the center of Ferrol, this is a very traditional and really charming place. Packed with locals having a meal or just a glass of wine at the bar. The prices are low and the quality high, with very friendly and helpful staff. The mussels are top notch and the most popular dish of the restaurant, "hígado encebollado" (liver and onions), is the best in the city - Although not for all tastes!

author: helio48
review_preview: We stopped in for lunch and had the BEST meal ever.....We started with clams....Scallops and cuttlefish  OMG good!!! Feel free to order anything on the menu...These folks are the real deal and we loved it!
review_full: We stopped in for lunch and had the BEST meal ever.....We started with clams....Scallops and cuttlefish  OMG good!!! Feel free to order anything on the menu...These folks are the real deal and we loved it!

author: FJGonzalezG
title_review: Simple and good enough neighborhood bar/reastaurant
review_preview: We had  bit of trouble choosing a place for a light dinner in Ferrol, and in the end we settled for A Vaca, probably because of the menu.  Seating was informal and at the bar.  The tapa served was a small bowl of  a nice...
review_full: We had bit of trouble choosing a place for a light dinner in Ferrol, and in the end we settled for A Vaca, probably because of the menu. Seating was informal and at the bar. The tapa served was a small bowl of a nice "sopa de fideos" (a light chicken soup with thin pasta). The service was friendly and efficient, greeting many customers as old friends. Seemed like everyone was in a festive mood for the carnivals. The "croquetas mixtas" and Queso San Simon da Costa with grilled veggies were good, as was the nice Rioja de Crianza served with it. Just what we needed.

author: Gabriel E
review_preview: Cuando nosotros parar en crucero desde Norway, buscar un restaurant para comer bueno y fue sensational. Un service muy bueno y comida genial. La precio fue muy bien. Nosotros volveremos pronto!!When se stopped in Spain while we were on a cruise from Norway, we...
review_full: Cuando nosotros parar en crucero desde Norway, buscar un restaurant para comer bueno y fue sensational. Un service muy bueno y comida genial. La precio fue muy bien. Nosotros volveremos pronto!! When se stopped in Spain while we were on a cruise from Norway, we were looking for a good restaurant and it was sensational. Very good service and great meal(very good value for money). Well be back soon!!

author: charcoalw
review_preview: When you're away working and home is distant, there is nothing more comforting than being treated like one of the family. A small part of our team turned up unnanaounced and the team at Alfonso's pulled a few tables together and the feast began. There...
review_full: When you're away working and home is distant, there is nothing more comforting than being treated like one of the family. A small part of our team turned up unnanaounced and the team at Alfonso's pulled a few tables together and the feast began. There is a superb bodegas [wine cellar] stocked with wines from all over the country [indeed world] but you cannot go wrong with wines produced in Galicia to accompany the gambas al aioli or a side of pimientos de padron. Contented colleagues slept well that night..!

author: AnaT I
review_full: Fuimos sin reserva y tuvimos suerte que quedaba una mesa libre, os recomiendo reservar. Se come de maravilla. Los camareros súper majos y muy atentos. De 10 os lo recomiendo al 100%.

author: Crossbow44
title_review: Enjoy a fine meal on the Port in Mugardos
review_preview: Excellent service by David, Rebecca and crew.  Kitchen is very good and plentiful portions.  Don’t miss the calamares !!
review_full: Excellent service by David, Rebecca and crew.  Kitchen is very good and plentiful portions.  Don’t miss the calamares !!

author: evatY5183SK
review_full: Es la tercera vez que voy, probé algún plato nuevo y me decanto 100% por el brioche con Sabor a albahaca! Qué plato más bueno, por favor!

author: lottar814
title_review: Best and biggest tapas I’ve ever has
review_preview: We ended up in Ferrol by accident since our car needed service. Had to spend the whole day here while we had it done but we could have been stuck in worse places. Consulted Trip advisor for advice. The two we were heading for were...
review_full: We ended up in Ferrol by accident since our car needed service. Had to spend the whole day here while we had it done but we could have been stuck in worse places. Consulted Trip advisor for advice. The two we were heading for were closed but this was in the same street. It as a good voice. We ordered a half racion (bigger than tapas) or patatas Ali oli (aioli) and one racion each of grilled squid and pork to share. Luckily the waiter told us it would be way too much. It certainly would have been. One half racion would have been enough by oh how we enjoyed it and luckily we had plenty of time. The fries with aioli were homemade and to die for. The grilled squid too. So tender it melted in your mouth. There were three different types of squid and the big calamari were a little bit more chewy than the others. Never had so good alioli and squid before! The waitress was really good about informing me what I could eat as being gluten intolerant. Ferrol is not a town you would normally go to but if you are here don’t miss going to this little gem

author: Maria G
title_review: Good quality food at a reasonable price
review_preview: We went there with a couple of friends, the place was crowded and there weren't any tables available. After a glass of wine, we saw a little table free, talk to the owner and he set it up immediately for four people. We ordered ham...
review_full: We went there with a couple of friends, the place was crowded and there weren't any tables available. After a glass of wine, we saw a little table free, talk to the owner and he set it up immediately for four people. We ordered ham and calamari croquetas, octopus and raxo. It was all delicious. Staff was very nice to us. Nice wine selection. Galician typical food with a nice modern touch. All good!

author: bjarkekl
title_review: A small jem with excellent food and wine
review_preview: We were a group of 7 colleagues that were out for find a place have dinner and stumbled over this small place. It don’t look of much from the outside, but in the back room they have a large dining room and a huge cooled...
review_full: We were a group of 7 colleagues that were out for find a place have dinner and stumbled over this small place. It don’t look of much from the outside, but in the back room they have a large dining room and a huge cooled vine display.  They don’t speak english at all, but they do their best to understand you and all with warm smile on the face.  We all found the food and service really good, this was for sure not the last time I visited Meson de Alfonso during my stay in Ferrol

author: mpatoga
review_preview: If you are planning to visit Ferrol this is a good option. Good service and quality with a not expensive price. Waiters and the owner are really handsome. Bad news:not daily menu with a good price
review_full: If you are planning to visit Ferrol this is a good option. Good service and quality with a not expensive price. Waiters and the owner are really handsome. Bad news:not daily menu with a good price

author: alexandramguedes
review_preview: The service is very nice, we enjoy good suggestions. The restaurant have a very impressive wine cellar with a complete complete spanish wine offer. We eat Pulpo a la Feria and Raxo, so good taste!
review_full: The service is very nice, we enjoy good suggestions. The restaurant have a very impressive wine cellar with a complete complete spanish wine offer. We eat Pulpo a la Feria and Raxo, so good taste!

author: X9182TIbrunoc
review_full: De lo mejor de Ferrol, un lugar muy acogedor y a la vez informal perfecto para tomar algo como para una buena comida/cena. Producto de muy buena calidad y atención perfecta. Desde que llegas con un entrante cortesía de la casa pasando por una explicación de cada plato de la carta por parte de los camareros, cantidad y calidad en cada plato. Pudiendo degustar zamburiñas de la ría algo muy poco habitual en la comarca ya que en la mayoría de los lugares ofrecen zamburiñas/ vieras del Pacífico como si fuesen zamburiñas. Todo correcto y de los mejores restaurantes que hay en Ferrol y comarca.

author: enfeo
review_full: Merece la pena siempre ir, pero algún plato nos ha decepcionado:  - salsa de aceite con algunos berberechos. Prefería berberechos solo con limón o con otra salsa o condimento, pero así el aceite se lleva todo el sabor.  - Cocochas, ricas, cantidad adecuada, pero sobra la ensalada de lechuga y tomate (nada más) y patatas fritas. -Postres: todos similares, no me dijeron nada los 2 que tomamos, en bote.

author: alejandrop106
review_full: Muy buen local y buen servicio, quizas un poco lentos para la poca gente que había. El pescado a la brasa bien, la carne (chuleton de vaca) normal tirando a mal. Por 40€/kg debería estar bastante mejor, no repetiría. La carta de vinos floja, además de que la mayoría de los que pone no los tienen.

author: Asder123
review_preview: Nice and light modern interior. Croquetas de jamon were slightly burned but the flavor was good. The chipirones fritos (fried squid) were also nice. The service was really horrible though and I know Spanish service is different. We were with local Spanish friends and even...
review_full: Nice and light modern interior. Croquetas de jamon were slightly burned but the flavor was good. The chipirones fritos (fried squid) were also nice. The service was really horrible though and I know Spanish service is different. We were with local Spanish friends and even they concluded that this was awful behaviour. Including two wines, one beer and a tonic we paid 22,30 euro.

author: interdumcritio
review_full: Aunque la voluntad de aparentar ser un lugar distinto y con una cocina elaborada no deja de ser un local de cafetería reconvertido, en todos los sentidos, en restaurante. Las elaboraciones normales, el servicio manifiestamente mejorable y el entorno de cafetería, ni tan siquiera un simple mantel desechable o servilletas de papel con una mínima calidad. El precio, si bien no excesivo, no se corresponde con lo servido.  Sólo comentar, como positivo, la bien elaborada bechamel de las croquetas de jamón ibérico invisible.  Una decepción.

author: Brais R
review_full: Siempre que podemos vamos a comer a este sitio y la verdad es que cada vez es mejor que la anterior. El trato genial, el camarero es muy atento y da un breve explicación de los platos. La comida es de una gran elaboración, con un género exquisito y muy bien tratado. El restaurante es pequeñito, lo que hace que no haya mucho ruido y exista un ambiente realmente agradable. Los precios son acordes a la calidad de la comida y el servicio prestado. Sin lugar a dudas, es una parada obligatoria.

author: manuserna
review_full: Pedimos el menú degustación para poder probar más cosas de las que tienen en la carta y la verdad es que fue una gozada cada plato. Desde el salmorejo de remolacha hasta el último postre. Todo riquísimo y con mucha elaboración y buena mano para la cocina.

author: Alcala3000
review_preview: I never saw the inside but this was always a reliable place to sit outside for a drink or a ,menu del dia' during my stay in Ferrol. Popular, so busy, but friendly.
review_full: I never saw the inside but this was always a reliable place to sit outside for a drink or a ,menu del dia' during my stay in Ferrol. Popular, so busy, but friendly.

author: SaraB8487
review_preview: The food was good, however the space was too crowded and with too many customers for the few employers.
review_full: The food was good, however the space was too crowded and with too many customers for the few employers.

author: TheLegendWiltshire
review_preview: We stopped here on a Saturday evening with our two year old for something to eat and drink. We found a table outside in the popular pedestrianised street intending to have a drink and tapas as it was well reviewed on Trip Advisor. The lady...
review_full: We stopped here on a Saturday evening with our two year old for something to eat and drink. We found a table outside in the popular pedestrianised street intending to have a drink and tapas as it was well reviewed on Trip Advisor. The lady promptly put a table cloth on the table and took our drink order. At that point she was very friendly and polite. When it came to the food order I ordered two tapas. She gave me a look of surprise and disdain. Her attitude changed instantly as she obviously wanted us to order more food and stay for a full meal. I guess etiquette dictates that on a busy weekend night people occupying the popular outside tables stay for longer but we only wanted a tapas or two. The food was ok, but they were then eager to move us on. The bill was presented rapidly and we realised we should leave. People were queuing for the tables outside. Don't go here for tapas on a weekend evening. It's obviously popular but for a sit down meal only.

author: Elena G
review_full: Trato exquisito y la comida de muy buena calidad. Estaba todo super bueno. Por poner una pega tardaron mucho en servir entre plato y plato.

author: AnaBFS
review_full: Sitio tranquilo, con una terraza cómoda y con una comida buenísima, con un trato agradable, amable y educado. Buena relación calidad-precio. Todo lo q pedimos buenísimo! Las almejas, zamburiñas y mejillones, de buen tamaño y sabor, a la brasa, que no las había comido de esa forma y muy ricas! Y no escatiman en cantidad. El secreto ideal, al igual q los entrantes que pedimos. Al igual q los postres! Para repetir cuando volvamos a Ferrol!!

author: joseluisgI4300VJ
review_full: Comimos de pinchos y nos sorprendieron las fantásticas zamburiñas a la brasa con aceite de albahaca, las almejas y los mejillones. Para terminar los postres nos dejaron encantados. Buena calidad precio y gran amabilidad y profesionalidad de todo el personal. Cuando volvamos a Ferrol seguro repetimos

author: jeremybS6023LI
review_full: Plats raffinés, la cuisson du poisson était tendre et les plats choisis délicieux. Nous sommes en Galice depuis 2 semaines, gros coup de cœur pour ce restaurant qui fait partie de nos préférés ! Merci pour l'accueil, nous reviendrons

author: mariajolago
review_full: Cenamos el menú degustación y todo impresionante, cada plato exquisito, cada bocado un placer y el camarero encantador, no me canso de repetir y volveremos en breve. Gracias por vuestro trabajo y por dejarnos disfrutar en Ferrol de cocina de esta calidad.

author: unamas14
review_full: Parada en ferrol, vimos este sitio con buenas referencias y decimos probar; una buena elección. Platos elaborados, con calidad y sabor. Tiene menú de degustación a un precio muy asequible y recomendable para probar más platos de la carta. Sin duda está será la primera de muchas, volveremos sin ninguna duda.

author: marypa
review_preview: Our first meal on Ferrol which was easy and good, used by locals. Very tasty and huge salad with baby squid and fried green pimento.  A real feast and all very local dishes. Excellent service and value for money
review_full: Our first meal on Ferrol which was easy and good, used by locals. Very tasty and huge salad with baby squid and fried green pimento.  A real feast and all very local dishes. Excellent service and value for money

author: rewold80
review_preview: Very helpful staff, good food (we eat sea food), nice beer...Close to the centr of city.Just one- nobody understand english :)Thank you!
review_full: Very helpful staff, good food (we eat sea food), nice beer...Close to the centr of city.Just one- nobody understand english :)Thank you!

author: Dreamconfood
review_full: El @casamaruxa es un restaurante que se encuentra en un lugar privilegiado de Ferrol  Si unimos una comida de calidad alta con un local bien cuidado y con un trato exquisito por parte del personal de este establecimiento, el resultado no puede ser mejor.  Lo mejor de la comida el solomillo y las croquetas. El dueño invitó a los cafés y a los chupitos “postcomilona”, detalle que antes era bastante habitual en los restaurantes, pero que cada vez ocurre en menos ocasiones, por lo que se agradece ✔️  El único pero ❌ que podemos subrayar es que la tarta de queso no tenía base de galleta, algo que para nosotros es imprescindible por lo que queda descartada para nuestro concurso. Probamos: Croquetas de jamón.  Zamburiñas de la ría.  Churrasco de ternera a la brasa.  Calamar a la brasa. Merluza y bacalao al estilo Maruxa.  Solomillo de ternera a la brasa. Almendrado de queso mascarpone  Tarta de la abuela Tarta de queso  Helado de mandarina y chocolate Y vosotros?? Con qué plato os quedaríais??  Bo proveito neniñ@s

author: ingrid r
review_full: Ensalada riquisima, marisco fresquisimo y Jugoslavien en salsa al pesto , atencion impecable, ambiente acogedor. El azar nos condujo à la Maruxa y nos deduktion tanto la carta Como la atención, Unos profesionales que te orientan y te ganan con su staber hacer

author: lourdes u
review_full: Descoberta de novos sabores com requinte e trabalhados com gosto. Ambiente tranquilo e decoração com gosto. Cozinha e atendimento excelentes

author: L3724XMmiguelm
review_full: Local acogedor con platos muy bien elaborados de cocina de mercado. Todos muy sabrosos, buena carta de vinos, trato cercano, y en cuanto a postres…la tarta de queso es espectacular.

author: cheloc323
review_full: Un restaurante muy agradable, la carta no es muy extensa pero es original, y los platos, por lo menos los que tomamos, estaban muy ricos, el servicio es rapido, agradable y discreto y la relación calidad-precio es buena. Un sitio muy recomendable

author: janiceHome
review_preview: Stopped for a refreshment, sat outside, we were served by a very nice waiter who also brought lovely tapas served in tiny little skillets, it was delicious--pork potatoes and peppers.  They also provided water for the doggy customers!
review_full: Stopped for a refreshment, sat outside, we were served by a very nice waiter who also brought lovely tapas served in tiny little skillets, it was delicious--pork potatoes and peppers.  They also provided water for the doggy customers!

author: christinahS7786JU
review_preview: Very friendly service, with good food for a real good price. Big raciones, 2 half raciones are enough for to people. Good regional vine, very busy place full of regionla people (always a good sign). Allways again!!!
review_full: Very friendly service, with good food for a real good price. Big raciones, 2 half raciones are enough for to people. Good regional vine, very busy place full of regionla people (always a good sign). Allways again!!!

author: JohnHallett
review_preview: The only good thing about this place was the friendly service. We waited far too long for the food to arrive and when it did it wasn't worth waiting for. Would never go again.
review_full: The only good thing about this place was the friendly service. We waited far too long for the food to arrive and when it did it wasn't worth waiting for. Would never go again.

author: H4767UMmarcom
review_full: Novale molto carino, elegante, cenato con calamari e totani alla griglia accompagnati da contorno di patate e pomodori, tutto molto buono, prezzo assolutamente onesto, contenti!

author: Guisanotti
title_review: Really charming place and amazing food.
review_preview: The place is just beautiful, with a mix of kitsch and nautical vibe, and the food is amazing - A mix too of Galician cuisine with a twist. Totally recommend for a nice and cozy dinner!
review_full: The place is just beautiful, with a mix of kitsch and nautical vibe, and the food is amazing - A mix too of Galician cuisine with a twist. Totally recommend for a nice and cozy dinner!

author: stuartclarkau
review_preview: I called the Mesón to book a table, my first attempt in Spanish. It was fully booked. The owner then asked "what time do you want to eat" I said 8 o'clock. He said fine come on in. Of course it was free at 8,...
review_full: I called the Mesón to book a table, my first attempt in Spanish. It was fully booked. The owner then asked "what time do you want to eat" I said 8 o'clock. He said fine come on in. Of course it was free at 8, the Spanish don't eat till 10:30 pm. Jose greeted us and we instantly struck a friendship as we are Australian and he has a good friend who also is. He helped us with the menu, translating, and suggesting the best dishes. The food was served quickly and was delicious, all home cooked. The wine, Alberińo was also great. After the meal we were then given some of his home made Orujo. Wow what a treat. Muchas gracias Jose. Highly recommended but book in advance if you want to eat at Spanish yikes.

author: Tanith P
review_preview: el Colonial 1921 is a real gem which is situated in the commercial town of Naron Galicia. The food is cheap and superb. the staff are polite and really fast. Unbeatable value. Their coffee flan is the best I have had in Galicia!
review_full: el Colonial 1921 is a real gem which is situated in the commercial town of Naron Galicia. The food is cheap and superb. the staff are polite and really fast. Unbeatable value. Their coffee flan is the best I have had in Galicia!

author: Crossbow44
review_preview: My wife and I, Victoria and Randy, thoroughly enjoyed a very pleasant 5 course meal...very exquisitely done.  The quality of the food, the style in which it is presented, the service and the great choices of wines as well as cocktails were superb.  We would...
review_full: My wife and I, Victoria and Randy, thoroughly enjoyed a very pleasant 5 course meal...very exquisitely done. The quality of the food, the style in which it is presented, the service and the great choices of wines as well as cocktails were superb. We would recommend “ The Taperia “for group events, catering as any special family activities during all seasons.

author: TravelerNYNy
title_review: Longing for Casa Lopez during social distancing!
review_preview: While we are apart, practicing social distancing, we all long for the good moments we had spent together in the past… The good memories: the good food, the good hosts, the good times… When I think about my beloved Ferrol, 6,000 km away, the first...
review_full: While we are apart, practicing social distancing, we all long for the good moments we had spent together in the past… The good memories: the good food, the good hosts, the good times… When I think about my beloved Ferrol, 6,000 km away, the first restaurant that comes to my mind is Casa Lopez. Granted! There are plenty of excellent restaurants in Ferrol that are worth a memory…: A Gabeira, O Camino do Ingles, Vanessa, O Parrulo, Bacorino, Casa Lexo… So many! Those places, big or small, sophisticated or not, where good memories happen, where the owners welcome you by your name with a smile, good food and the opportunity for memories to become such. But out of them all, today, while I hear people applauding outside my apartment in NYC, I am thinking of Casa Lopez. Initially, I wondered whether it was because of its non-traditional flavors: Mexican, Thai… But alas!, I can get that anywhere in NYC… Also, there are other places in Ferrol where you can enjoy a tiradito (O Camino do Ingles) or an excellent ceviche (A Gabeira -Chef Miguel, my respects to you, the BEST fish chef in GALICIA!!!). Why Casa Lopez then? Why is it hitting my memory again and again? Could it be its secluded location? Its low-key style? Its tables, labeled with the name of the reservation…? I do not know. I only know that when I go into Casa Lopez, we just enjoy the smile of Pablo. Pablo is THE RESTAURANT. The reason why we want to come back. The most humble, unpretentious, hardworking, pleasing chef, we have ever met. He creates a welcoming environment by being himself. By not trying hard. But by giving it all. Food that is great, cooked with the heart. Food that gives. Behavior that is honest. Pablo works, Pablo delivers. But best of all, Pablo continues to be Pablo. And this, by itself, deserves the best memory. That is why today I feel I need to give Pablo and the team 5 starts. Because I cannot wait to go back and visit him. To taste his Burrito Lopez, his Indian croquettes and, best of all, his pad Thai with extra sriracha (upon request by his friends…). Casa Lopez: you are in my list of places to come back. Please stay safe. We are all thinking of you. Far, in the distance, but all together.

author: charcoalw
review_preview: Dropped in her on way back from work at outer port late one evening.The Estrella Galicia was perfect as was the simple but delicious food served, all for twenty euro's or so and I was stuffed..!
review_full: Dropped in her on way back from work at outer port late one evening.The Estrella Galicia was perfect as was the simple but delicious food served, all for twenty euro's or so and I was stuffed..!

author: aliciao439
review_preview: Nice place with local food and also have drinks. Service was OK as they only have one server for the full place. He was moted to be a little stressed out with work.
review_full: Nice place with local food and also have drinks. Service was OK as they only have one server for the full place. He was moted to be a little stressed out with work.

author: Alcala3000
title_review: Recommended.   Worth coming to Ferrol for.
review_preview: I really enjoyed this, even though I was dining alone on a Tuesday night. The couple who run this restaurant, and do all the cooking and serving, made me feel 'at home' and showed real care. Everything was presented beautifully.    I actually got the feeling...
review_full: I really enjoyed this, even though I was dining alone on a Tuesday night. The couple who run this restaurant, and do all the cooking and serving, made me feel 'at home' and showed real care. Everything was presented beautifully. I actually got the feeling that they were running this restaurant because it gave them pleasure!! The decor is excentric but fantastically clean. The background music was excellent jazz.

author: FedericoB749
title_review: Great Dinner at a pleasant place
review_preview: What a great restaurant in Ferrol , great product , 14 different dishes to share or Not.... Robaliza , Steak Tartar, Zamburiñas, Carrillera, Caballas, Salmon, Cod, etc. Every dish was cook to perfection , delicious deserts, good service, a restaurant with character and identity. A...
review_full: What a great restaurant in Ferrol , great product , 14 different dishes to share or Not.... Robaliza , Steak Tartar, Zamburiñas, Carrillera, Caballas, Salmon, Cod, etc. Every dish was cook to perfection , delicious deserts, good service, a restaurant with character and identity. A place to go.

author: Alcala3000
review_preview: This realy is a meson. Good hearty food, good drink and a genuine welcome. I am obviously a foriegner but I was welcomed, supported and well fed.A memeorable evening. I will be back one day soon
review_full: This realy is a meson. Good hearty food, good drink and a genuine welcome. I am obviously a foriegner but I was welcomed, supported and well fed.A memeorable evening. I will be back one day soon

author: Asta365
review_preview: Situated in the old town, O Carabel was a good choice for tapas.  While most patrons were watching Man U play Real Madrid, the hosts kept the tapas, wine, and beer coming for a full house.  Our tapas were a very well-prepared set of sardines,...
review_full: Situated in the old town, O Carabel was a good choice for tapas. While most patrons were watching Man U play Real Madrid, the hosts kept the tapas, wine, and beer coming for a full house. Our tapas were a very well-prepared set of sardines, two types of croquettes - chorizo and squid ink, and a fish mousse. Not knowing the local red wines, we asked our host for his recommendation and he brought us a Ribera Sacra which had all the classic characteristics of this style (and checked off one of my food goals for this trip). Prices are in line with the quality of the food and wine.

author: ivok143
title_review: Good food and very good service
review_preview: Great if you feel very welcome by the owner who is explaining the options, offers a different wine with a second glass. The dishes have been well prepared and very original for this part of the country. The owner still wants to keep the spirit...
review_full: Great if you feel very welcome by the owner who is explaining the options, offers a different wine with a second glass. The dishes have been well prepared and very original for this part of the country. The owner still wants to keep the spirit of a taverna, which we appreciated. Very good value!

author: Gabriela S
review_preview: It is a small restaurant, so booking would be advisable. The cooking is superb. All the products are  fresh and the chef takes great care in selecting the best quality ingredients. It also provides a good selection of Spanish wines . And the service accompanies...
review_full: It is a small restaurant, so booking would be advisable.  The cooking is superb. All the products are fresh and the chef takes great care in selecting the best quality ingredients. It also provides a good selection of Spanish wines . And the service accompanies the high quality of the cooking.

author: TravelerNYNy
title_review: Casa Lopez proofs that Ferrol Mola!
review_preview: I have been returning to Casa Lopez with my family and with my friends many times since my last review. Chef Pablo continues to cook outstanding food with an interesting twist. The menu evolves but the essence remains: good food, great surprises, and an excellent...
review_full: I have been returning to Casa Lopez with my family and with my friends many times since my last review. Chef Pablo continues to cook outstanding food with an interesting twist. The menu evolves but the essence remains: good food, great surprises, and an excellent use of spices and cooking techniques, accommodating the local taste but, at the same time, departing from what is conventional in Ferrol. Casa Lopez is a pioneer in bringing Thai, Mexican, Tex-Mex, Indian and other flavors to Ferrol. But what makes this place especial is that Pablo and his team continue to show immense enthusiasm in every meal, making small little details (like the marinated olives served in a wooden plate –which are outstanding), into something that prompts you to dream of being there again and again. The wine list is also surprising (with very good and affordable options) and the menu changes over time which makes a return always interesting. It is always hard to leave a dish out when it comes to choosing! Prices are absolutely reasonable given the amount of love and care from the kitchen. Thanks Pablo for being so humble and talented. We cannot wait to be back during the summer. Ferrol Mola! for sure!

author: fun2fun
review_preview: The restaurant has only 6 tables.The menu has about 8 items (beside deserts). Some of the items are from the Asian kitchen, some ate Spanish - interesting mixture, but we found out to be very testy. We tried the Pad Thai - which was...
review_full: The restaurant has only 6 tables. The menu has about 8 items (beside deserts). Some of the items are from the Asian kitchen, some ate Spanish - interesting mixture, but we found out to be very testy. We tried the Pad Thai - which was excellent, very fresh and made the moment we ordered it, I took the beef steak - very good. For starter we share a salad of tomatoes with tuna fish - so simple, so good, so genius!

author: TravelerNYNy
review_preview: Casa Lopez was, for sure, the highlight of these Christmas holidays in Ferrol. Having heard of Pablo and his new restaurant a few months ago, I could not wait to try his cooking. I was completely right: Casa Lopez is a great new discovery in...
review_full: Casa Lopez was, for sure, the highlight of these Christmas holidays in Ferrol. Having heard of Pablo and his new restaurant a few months ago, I could not wait to try his cooking. I was completely right: Casa Lopez is a great new discovery in Ferrol. First, the place is absolutely charming, not your usual restaurant. With lots of imagination (and good taste), they have refurbished a decadent bar, creating an enchanting atmosphere. The waitress was very welcoming and accommodating. She wanted to please and create a memorable experience. We appreciated it. We started with a drink and some olives. They clearly were marinated properly, served in a wooden plate. Since it was a light lunch, we ordered four little plates: the empanadillas, the burrito Lopez, Thai rice and canelones. The empanadillas were made of wonton chips, filled with sardines. A great idea and very tasty. The burrito is Pablo’s take on the usual burrito, made with soft tortillas. The flavor was amazing. The Thai rice was excellent in flavor and perfectly cooked (they served about a bowl of rice). Finally, the canelones were extremely soft and rich, filled with béchamel sauce and chicken. Amazing. Everything was cooked to perfection. We did not find the portions small at all and they were very easy to share. Pablo himself came to greet us and that was a very nice gesture of his. We truly recommend Casa Lopez, what a great discovery. Make sure you have a reservation in advance.

author: chleong84
review_preview: The restaurant just located opposite Cassil hotel. Is a very small and lovely small little family restaurants. Had tried their homemade dish very tasty and nice.
review_full: The restaurant just located opposite Cassil hotel. Is a very small and lovely small little family restaurants. Had tried their homemade dish very tasty and nice.

author: Silvia R
title_review: Delicious bites in a very cosy environment!
review_preview: My boyfriend and I ventured it to Casa Lopez one very dark and rainy January day. I am not sure whether the weather kept misbehaving while we were eating, though, once we had the first bite there was only one thing we kept thinking about...how...
review_full: My boyfriend and I ventured it to Casa Lopez one very dark and rainy January day. I am not sure whether the weather kept misbehaving while we were eating, though, once we had the first bite there was only one thing we kept thinking about...how long it would take for the next one to arrive! We firstly sat at the bar. Ordered a glass of wine and a pint -yes! a pint. You don't see this around that much in Galicia...With our drinks we got a little bowl of "caldo gallego" (Galician stew). So comforting! Then we sat at a table. Since we could not make up our minds about what to eat, we let Pablo -the chef- choose. He prepared a fantastic selection of dishes from delicious little sardine pasties to fish balls to a scrumptious meaty/veggie wok. The service was equally matched with great efficiency and, also, great suggestions and tips! Spanish and English are spoken so, this time, we could leave the dictionary in the bag. We will definitely be going back when we are in the area and, you should do too! Yum yum!!!

author: enfeo
review_full: Hace un año que lleva abierto y por fin en agosto hemos podido ir! Después de muchos viernes-sábados sin poder ir por no tener mesa libre (aunque sí siempre la barra), por fin hemos podido ir y ya van 2 veces! La atención de 10, la comida también. Quizás demasiados platos diferentes para el tipo de carta que tiene, pero todo tiene muy buen sabor. Sólo hubo un plato muy picante, que no pude pasar del primer bocado. A destacar el postre con dados de piña y coco!

author: XianaX
review_full: Poco conocido y haciendo referencia a su nombre, Sinxelo es un local minimalista, sencillo y con pocas mesas donde pasar una grata velada saboreando sus platos. Raciones acordes al precio..6 raciones para 4 personas es suficiente aunque veas unos platos minimalistas, no reluce eñ producto pues en su mayoría son básicos pero buen sabor. Vinos sin carta expuestos en barra (pocos conocidos pero buenas marcas a buen precio). Personal agradable, rápido y servicial. Sin duda merece la pena una visita, el problema es que su carta es reducida ybsi no la varían las visitas serán muy esporádicas.

author: T7817NWsaran
review_full: Todo estaba muy rico y la presentación muy original y detallista en cada uno de los platos. Nuestro favorito fue el bonito marinado. Recomendamos coger 5-4 platos para 3 personas. El postre fue lo más sencillo, una tartaleta de frutos rojos.

author: AlejandroP237
review_full: Local con salón de mesas bajas y zona de barra con mesas altas.  Cena 2 personas: - Bonito marinado, gazpacho remolacha, manzana: rico. - Xurelo en salazon, churney albaricoque, salsa citricos: rico. - Salpicon de volandeira y raya, licuado pimiento verde: rico. - Arroz de langostinos, salsa americana, mayonesa lima: muy rico. - Brioche cruceta iberica: muy rico. - Canelon pollo asado, bechamel de queso san simon, jugo: bien, el pollo quizás un poco seco. - Morro guisado con patatas fritas: muy rico - Tartaleta frutos rojos: muy rica - Vasito de limón y chocolate blanco: muy rico - Milhoja crema pastelera: rico  91€ junto con 4 vermouth, 2 cafes.  Personal atento y amable.

author: cintiapd10
review_full: Si os pasáis por Ferrol o si sois de la zona no podéis perder la oportunidad de degustar los platos fabulosos que tienen en este local. Es un restaurante con una muy buena variedad en su carta, que cambia los platos con respecto a los productos de temporada. Siempre productos de calidad. Trato excelente, y local acogedor.

author: JMAP79
review_full: Para empezar el local es acogedor y moderno a la vez, después te atienden y te aconsejan de maravilla, incluso en las cantidades a pedir ya que las raciones son generosas. Las carnes y pescados a la brasa son espectaculares. La carta no es muy larga, pero es que es más lo que te ofrecen fuera de carta, según mercado, que los platos fijos. Resumiendo, precio moderado y calidad y atención excelente. Ya repetimos!

author: Bmsru
review_full: Fuimos una pareja con una niña de 4 años. Sitio acogedor, servicio inmejorable y platos riquisimos. Muy recomendable

author: TROSKI
review_full: Con la carta en las manos y una vez ojeada tengo que decir que me esperaba una cena con sabor agridulce.  Pero tengo que decir que la experiencia ha sido muy gratificante.  Platos elaborados y muy buena materia prima. Una explosión de sabores. Para volver.

author: 718pilars
review_full: Hemos vuelto a comer y puedo decir que cada vez que vamos nos sorprende. Ambiente y local agradables . El personal encantador . Y que decir de la comida ; una explosión de sabor . Calidad precio excelente. Felicitar a todo el personal y especialmente a los cocineros . Se nota que les gusta su trabajo .

author: H4148APalejandrom
review_full: No dejéis de visitar este local, carta variada pero siempre con platos riquísimos, buenos vinos y el trato excepcional.

author: lau3lyt
review_full: Excelente atención y relación calidad precio inmejorable. Cocina de autor con fusión de sabores y una presentación muy cuidada.

author: C9498OJjavierd
review_full: Fui hace un par de días y me encantó, tanto la atención como la comida increíble. Comimos caballa sopleteada, steak tartar (de los mejores que he comido), albóndigas de ibéricos y brioche y quedamos llenisimos. Tanto la caballa como el steak nos hicieron medias raciones para que pudiéramos probar más cosas. Relación calidad-precio buenísima.

author: ux_an2019
review_full: No es la primera vez que vamos y los platos siempre riquísimos. La carta es muy variada y se va adaptando a los productos de temporada. Atención exquisita, rápidos y atentos. No podría elegir un solo plato…postres me quedo con la tarta de queso, la mejor que he probado!

author: Maripuri P
review_full: Los berberechos no saben como tal asi como los mejillones. El pescado no sabe a la brasa sino a medio cocido medio asado. Cuidado porque no guardan la reserva si les conviene darsela a alguien que a el (Fernando) le venga en gana. Ojito no es oro todo lo que reluce

author: jorgedO4636EI
review_full: Un lugar muy bonito, carnes excelentes a la brasa. Los chocos también muy buenos. Precio normal. Vinos adsequibles. Buen trato.

author: juliojosev2016
review_full: Local cómodo y acogedor. La comida de calidad: variedad en mariscos, pescados y carnes( especialidades a la brasa). Servicio muy atento. Recomendado para familias, parejas o negocios

author: Alberto V
review_full: Buena cocina. La carne exquisita. El chef te atiende y asesora personalmente. El mayor problema, el nivel de ruido. La gente en general habla muy alto, probablemente por la inmediatez de la barra.  Debo precisar que fui un domingo y había mucha animación.

author: martavelmez
review_full: La comida es excelente, los platos están muy elaborados y tienen un sabor espectacular. El personal, muy amable y el ambiente, agradable. Nos lo recomendaron y fue un acierto, repetiremos.

author: O611RLdavidf
review_full: Local acogedor,comida muy rica y muy bien presentada,acompañada de un albariño recomendado por el camarero que sin duda acertó y fue muy amable los postres excelentes me quedo con la milhoja (para gustos)sin duda para volver muchas gracias.

author: G2977LKantoniob
review_full: Nuevo local, sobrio y sencillo pero con una cocina de calidad, sin estridencias y bien acompañada de sus caldos. Sigamos en esta línea y estoy seguro de que conseguirá un buen hueco en la restauración de la zona

author: Lavozdelpuebloyamigo
review_full: Hemos comido en la terraza, y la camarera rubia muy a sido la persona más atenta y amable de los restaurantes de todos los que hemos estado estás vacaciones. La comida buenísima , y las raciones casi para dos, volveremos en cuanto podamos  Super bien gracias por todo

author: MADVS
review_full: Ferrol,me ha dejado gratamente sorprendido, por su hospitalidad ,pero sobre todo por su variedad gastronómica, donde puedes degustar una buena carne como un excelente marisco o pescado y este Restaurante consigue ambos pero la especialidad es a la brasa,el comensal saldra satisfecho, con una relacion precio-comida muy buena, con un srrvicio de buena porción y con un g Sabor que los dejara encantado,no dejen de cenir a este Restaurante .

author: interdumcritio
review_full: Un lugar agradable, acogedor y con un trato profesional y amable. Recomiendo el menú del día. Hoy, en concreto, paella de pescado y marisco con una caballa asada de segundo, filloa de postre con pan y bebida por 10€. Inmejorable.

author: beltranfor
review_full: Un local pequeño, sencillo a la par que elegante, donde relajarse... Y cuando llega la comida, no decepciona, una comida elaborada, con multitud de sabores y mezclas de ingredientes que hacen de uno de los Locales donde no fallarás si vas a comer. Una carta amplia de vinos. Se ha convertido en un habitual en nuestras salidas!

author: Pperher
review_full: Unha carta axustada con moito gusto. Probamos chocos cun sabor esquisito e unha preparación moi orixinal. Os postres de escándalo... todo perfecto volveremos

author: pablor123
review_full: Excelente cocina y trato para un restaurante con un corto recorrido, no exento de calidad en los fogones. Gran relación calidad/precio. Para los más excépticos por la situacióm del covid19, destacar el control de aforo y la sensación de seguridad en el interior del local. Para repetir sin duda!!

author: sandracN2103JO
review_full: El servicio es muy bueno y la comida está muy sabrosa. Se trata de una cocina de mercado a un precio bastante absequible. El sitio es acogedor y tranquilo.

author: crisclain
review_full: Fuimos acompañados de unos amigos a probar este restaurante en Ferrol, tenía buena puntuación y nos lo habían recomendado.  El local está bastante cuidado, es pequeñito pero se hace agradable. El trato fue bastante bueno, nos explicaron muy bien toda la carta y los platos fuera de carta. Todo lo que probamos estaba muy bien hecho y con producto excelente.  Para volver y seguir probando.

author: justoe2017
review_full: Estuve picando una noche en compañía de unos amigos. Íbamos con prisa, pero aún así pudimos probar el calamar a la brasa y el secreto ibérico, ambos muy ricos. Tiene buenos vinos. La atención muy buena. No es el más barato de la zona, pero muy bien. Repetiremos con más calma

author: soysmp
review_full: Un restaurante que se debe visitar en Ferrol sin ninguna duda, buena calidad de producto, unos excelentes berberechos a la brasa, una ensalada fresca y con gran sabor, para continuar con una parrillada (chorizo criollo y churrasco de ternera)de gran calidad y en su punto. Para terminar con un postre de quesos de la zona con membrillo y nueces, todo ello acompañado de un vino tinto de la zona de valdeorras excelente. Todo ello bien presentado y aconsejado por el dueño, dándole las gracias por su recomendación. Volveremos

author: aagcoruna
review_full: Local en el centro de la ciudad al lado de los cantones con buena terraza en verano. Fundamentalmente tienen buenas carnes aunque siempre te ofrecen un plato de pescado que te puede apetecer. Los berberechos lo sirven en la clásica bacenilla con una salsa exquisita. La carta de vinos es fantástica. Tiene referencias de varias denominaciones de origen con algunas marcas poco conocidas pero una magnífica selección. El servicio es amable y el dueño pendiente de que todo el mundo salga satisfecho.

author: emilio a
review_full: El servicio magnífico, nos aconsejaron qué pedir sobre todo en los platos fuera de carta que tenían ese día. Nos gustaron mucho las zamburiñas y la picaña estaba fantástica. Me sorprendió el mini Gin Tonic, excelente. De los mejores que he tomado.

author: David H
review_full: Lo mejor sin duda el servicio que junto a la buena comida resulta una magnifica experiencia gastronómica. Solamente se le puede añadir la pega del calamar que resultó estar no tan acorde como el resto de los platos; de hecho ha sido lo único que ha sobrado. Adicionalmente se echan en falta platos veganos / vegetarianos.

author: alejandrolU7399PM
review_full: Restaurante de calidad en el centro de Ferrol. Cena entre amigos con excelente pescado y buenos entrantes (zamburiñas a la plancha) . Buena atencion y recomendación de vino para acompañar.

author: anan497
review_full: Fuimos a visitar a mi hijo y paramos a tomar un vino por casualidad.pesimos la carta y decidimos quedarnos a cenar.Espectacular todo y que decir de los postres eran lo más,estaban deliciosas esas cañitas.No me puedo olvidar de los camareros que son encantadores.Volveremos.

author: G7567ISclaudiaa
review_full: Cena exquisita, trato inmejorable! Encantadas de haber cenado aquí, lo recomendaremos y esperamls repetir pronto!

author: Rosi F
review_full: Siempre como bien aquí, el local es acogedor, el personal...simplemente excelente, igual que la comida. No importa si es menú o a la carta, siempre está rico rico. Hoy menú: callos y brocheta de pollo, agua y postre. 10€

author: X6982JLpaulas
review_full: El local precioso, la atención exquisita y la comida llena de sabor y Muy buena materia prima. Recomendable 100%

author: Jose T
review_full: He ido varias veces con amigos y es el sitio perfecto para ello. La atención es súper profesional, están muy implicados y conocen muy bien su producto. Te cuentan lo que tienen con pasión. Incluso te aconsejan, muy majos. La comida está buenísima, producto fresco gallego bien tratado, postres caseros.  Tuvimos un problema con mi tarjeta (se duplicó el pago) y lo solucionaron rápido y eficazmente. Lo recomendaría y de hecho suelo recomendarlo, es una suerte que Ferrol tenga lugares como este con gente joven y con damas y talento.

author: TereAlvarez13
review_full: Fuimos a cenar con unos amigos que nos recomendaron el restaurante. Pedimos para compartir ensalada de rúcula, cherries y mozzarella y carpaccio de bacalao. Estaba todo muy rico. Después pedimos carne y bacalao y también estaba muy bueno. De postre filloas de crema y tarta de la abuela. Quizás los precios son muy altos. La atención de los camareros era espectacular aunque eran sólo 3 para todo el local y evidentemente era insuficiente aunque nosotros no tenemos queja porque nos atendieron perfectamente en todo momento.

author: blancodmar
review_full: Probamos el menú de Navidad, unos 7 platos para compartir. Lo más rico y original el xurelo con crema de coliflor. Buena carta de vinos. El comedor es pequeño, cabrán una 20-25 personas(unas 6-8 mesas), decorado sencillo en blanco y madera. Está ubicado en zona con fácil aparcamiento, aunque bastante concurrida. Cocina de diseño con sabores de siempre y un servicio excelente. Mejor reservar.

author: María I
review_full: La comida estupenda, original y bien preparada. El servicio excelente. Quizás las raciones un poco mas grandes por lo que pagas por ellas, 7 raciones para 5, resultó bien. Pero las raciones algo escasas

author: Camabay
review_full: Fui con mi pareja a probar este restaurante, atraídos por el hecho de que el cocinero había trabajado bastante tiempo en O Camiño do Inglés, que nos encanta. El local es agradable, aunque pequeño. La camarera que nos atendió fue encantadora y nos explicó muy bien los platos.  Nos recomendó pedir 3 raciones para dos. Aunque las raciones están pensadas para compartir, quizás son un poco pequeñas. Probamos las tapas del tapéate (albacora con salmorejo y manzana): muy buenas. Después un arroz con langostinos, increíble, con muchísimo sabor. Estaba tan rico que se nos hizo poco. Y por último croca con boletus, también muy buena.  De postres pedimos un vasito de chocolates y la milhoja de crema. Esta estaba riquísima, supercrujiente.  El precio, medio: se come por unos 25-30€ persona. Seguro que repetiremos.

author: nataliapV7160NC
review_full: Esperando a que se levanten las restricciones para poder comer/cenar en el propio local. Comida muy sabrosa y muy buena presentación para su consumo en casa. La atención muy buena. Muy recomendable. Buena relación calidad/precio

author: enfeo
review_full: Me mata el ruído ambiente del local! Las raciones tirando a grandes, lo cual está bien, siempre que se coma todo.  Probamos los mejillones, que a pesar de ser novedosos por abrirlos en albahaca, no sabían a mucho más que a mejillón.

author: encinap2016
review_full: Hemos ido mi marido y yo , con nuestro hijo. Buena carta de vinos, buen pescado, buenos entrantes, buen postre... y lo mismo con la atención . En resumen, ni un pero, para repetir y disfrutar

author: DayTrip639631
review_full: Trato profesional ,exquisito el choco y los berberechos a la brasa. El chef te explica antes de pedir la carta , así es mucho más fácil

author: 68Ana1968
review_full: Tomamos berberechos y navajas de entrante para compartir y estaban muy buenos. De segundo bacalao, entrecot de vaca y magret de pato. Todo muy rico y abundante pero el sabor del magret lo mejor para mí. Los postres también estaban muy ricos.

author: catwoman56000
review_full: Petite cerveza en terrasse. Top .  Ils savent accueillir avec un petit en cas. Ça change des cacahouètes en que l'on nous offre en France Accueil chaleureux, très souriant

author: fuersan
review_full: Nuestro caso fue el de estos sitios que encuentras por casualidad. Ya era la hora de comer e íbamos buscando, vimos el lugar y acertamos de pleno. Es un local muy agradable y son muy amables. La comida deliciosa: unas almejas a la brasa y una robaliza que estaban estupendas y cañas deliciosas de postre. Nos dejó con ganas de volver

author: Xoa C
review_full: Buen producto y buen trato. Local cómodo. Precios razonables. Platos tradicionales y también alguno sorprendente. los pops con jalapeños ricos.

author: Ana G
review_full: Probamos tanto el menu del día como algun plato de carta, las carnes muy bien preparadas, los mariscos para nuestro gusto un poco insulsos. Buena calidad. Buen surtido en postres.

author: olgak26
review_full: Un sitio precioso, la comida insuperable (zamburiñas, almejas y chuleton fuera de serie, un pan que se podría comer solo y por encima de todo, una atención cálida, amable, simpática y sin duda, que provoca volver ...e invitar a los que pasen por aquí

author: Monicarmen
review_full: Comimos bastate bien Las navajas de muy buena calidad y nos sorprendió la cantidad para dos personas.. Trato agradable y en general recomendable

author: W1099DMcristinad
review_full: Encontramos el sitio de casualidad y no pudimos salir más contentos!!! Tardaron un poquito en atendernos (estaban hasta arriba), pero mereció muchísimo la espera. El camarero nos aconsejó sobre cantidades, cosa que agradecimos enormemente  Las zamburiñas de Ferrol y las cigalas increíbles!!!! Las cocochas y el entrecot, de 10!! Y los postres: rocas de chocolate y tarta de la abuela, de los mejores postres q hemos probado.

author: F4268VEfernandod
review_full: Había ido antes y tenía buen recuerdo de este sitio pero en esta ocasión...  No me gustó a pesar de la excelente compañía. La comida a la carta regular El ambiente bien, pero el precio caro. Me defraudó.

author: 13beatrizr
review_full: Precios elevados en relación con la calidad y la cantidad. Si te recomiendan este sitio es que no te quieren bien

author: misterkoffee
review_full: Local bonito y acogedor. Muy buen servicio y atención. Materia prima buena y bien elaborada. Muy destacable el menú del día y la carta donde me decanto principalmente por su sencillez primando el producto. Postres ricos y mejorable el café.

author: 257milinkoa
review_full: Visita en familia a conocer este establecimiento, la realidad es que tiene una carta moderna y muy asequible económicamente, la atención más que correcta, hemos probado varios platos de la carta y nos han gustado mucho, que sigan así que les irá muy bien, sin duda para volver en más ocasiones

author: Puripaqui
review_full: Fui en dos ocasiones a este nuevo establecimiento: la primera vez, a comer y la segunda, a cenar y en ambos casos salí muy satisfecha. Aunque, como dicen los camareros, los platos están pensados para compartir, nosotros pedimos un par de entrantes para todos, un plato principal para cada uno y los correspondientes postres. Debo advertir que todos los comensales teníamos "bastante saque". Quizá para una persona que no coma mucho, le podría parecer excesivo. El tamaño de las raciones es suficiente para dividir entre 2 ó 3 personas. Los platos están muy bien preparados y algunos son algo sorprendentes. Adrián, que es el chef, suele cambiar la carta según la temporada e intenta introducir nuevas propuestas con bastante frecuencia. Tomamos un vino de la Ribera del Duero con un precio correcto. El local es moderno y acogedor y el personal es muy atento y profesional. La relación calidad-precio es la adecuada teniendo en cuenta la preparación y la calidad de los productos

author: RocioFerrol
review_full: Una opción diferente en Ferrol, estilo al Camiño y Josefa’s. Nueva cocina, pero por ahora con un precio asequible. Te recomienda plato y medio par persona. Unos 30 e por cabeza. No hay mucha variedad y las raciones son pequeñas pero diferentes e interesantes. El arroz me gustó menos. No es para ir a menudo pero si, recomiendo probarlo.

author: 517dimasl
review_full: Buen sitio para comer, con una carta con bastante variedad. Muy rica las carnes, tanto la picaña como el entrecot, impresionantes los mejillones con salsa marinera a base de albahaca. Todo acompañado de bien vino de Godello y cerrado con un fantástico requesón. Muy recomendable.

author: olgavW5676QR
review_full: El servicio no es bueno, al camarero le cambió la cara cuando alguien del grupo solicitó el menú del dia. El calamar estaba duro como un corcho, pusieron una sola guarnición para dos platos de cocochas, y cuatro trozos de pan para cinco personas. Cuando pedimos más pan, volvieron a poner un bollito pequeño cortado en cuatro trozos, como la primera vez, para cinco personas. El camarero aseguró que la lubina era para 3/4 raciones y cuando llegó era de ración. No hace falta decir que el postre y el café lo tomamos en otro sitio.

author: isabelfM8627KP
review_full: zamburiñas sin sabor a precio de oro . 4 trozos de pulpo muy caro, un calamar sin sabor y una entraña lamentable. Pero lo más lamentable es que te vendan que todo es a la brasa y te traigan patatas recalentadas salí con un agujero en el bolsillo y mal comido. Nunca más ( local maldito)

author: Jomalfonso
review_full: Surgió un viaje rápido a Ferrol y coincidió la hora de comer. Acudimos a este local animados por sus buenas críticas, que compartimos totalmente. Muy buen trato y un estimable asesoramiento sobre el menú (tipo de comida y cantidad), sin forzar en absoluto. El producto de primer orden (almejas, zamburiñas, lubina ...) y la elaboración esmerada. Buena carta de vinos, con algunas etiquetas que no aparecen en la carta pero que te ofrecen por si te gusta probar cosas nuevas. Precio razonable y local diáfano y acogedor. Supongo que los días de "abarrote" el volumen de las voces debe ser alto, pero son muy escasos los locales en que no sucede así. Lo dicho, vale la pena ...

author: alfonso f
review_full: Comida excelente toda a la brasa. Muy buen trato por parte de los camareros, que son muy profesionales y se agrecede muchísimo.  Comimos Navajas (excelentes de la ría de Ferrol), un calamar a la plancha y picaña ( muy muy tierna y rica). A los cafés fuimos invitados. No es muy barato, pero merece la pena. Recomendado y volveremos, por supuesto.

author: constantinov212
review_full: Normal.....nunca mejor dicho, no es un local que vaya a proponer para cenas futuras. Además , teníamos reserva para las 22:30 y cuándo llegamos tenían nuestra mesa ocupada y tuvimos que esperar hasta las 23:00

author: Nuria S
review_full: Hemos ido a comer el menú del día, (teníamos reserva) por recomendación de una amistad. Justo entrar nos atendió una chica rubia super maja, en cuanto nos sentamos nos atendieron al momento,el menú 100% recomendable y la atención al público exquisita y todo ello por 10 euros. Desde luego repetiremos.

author: paloppalop
review_full: Fui tres veces y las tres perfecto todo. Mejor comprobarlo uno mismo. Gran variedad de vinos y muy ricos. La comida una forma diferente de cocinar.

author: Trail678799
review_full: Imperdonable que tuvieramos que comer los platos principales sin pan para un restaurante que nos cobró 26 € por 6 piezas de cocochas con mucha salsita, los camareros muy amables pero saturados. No volvería con mi familia nunca mais.

author: jaime f
review_full: Muy mala experiencia, pedimos tres platos para compartir: Unas croquetas que estaban buenas Zamburiñas plancha que estaban bien Y un entrecot de Angus, muy mejorable. Lo mejor es que nos preguntan si queremos algo para acompañar la carne pensando que iría incluido en el precio de la carne y nos traen una fuente de verduras salteadas, que mas que pasadas por el Wok lo que debieron hacer fue acercarlas y nos cobraron, creo recordar unos 11 €.

author: enriqued187
review_full: Opción muy recomendable para probar sabores clásicos pero reinventados, en el barrio de Esteiro en Ferrol. He ido varias veces y lo recomiendo sin duda.  Los platos de la carta van cambiando dependiendo de la temporada del año, pero siempre tendremos algun plato con crudos más arriesgados y otra parte de la carta más clásica para que todos los públicos prueben. Mención especial para la merluza con nabizas, el foie y el solomillo con mojo.

author: NOMASDECONSTRUCCION
review_full: Fácil aparcamiento en las inmediaciones,buena atención y producto de primera.Un local pequeño y acogedor ambientado con música jazz que cuenta con barra y sala separada.La idea es compartir pequeños platos muy bien elaborados con materia de primera.Postres también muy ricos.Gran café. Enhorabuena y suerte.

author: aagcoruna
review_full: Esta nueva opción es totalmente recomendable. Ofrecen nueva cocina pero adaptada a todos los públicos. Tapas para compartir. Precio razonable. La merluza y el abadejo muy buenos, al igual q las legumbres. La atención buena. Necesario reservar porque el local es pequeño.

author: presiamanda
review_full: Muy interesante el concepto que tienen de cañita, porque hay veces que no quieres ni un corto, ni una pedazo de caña de esas típicas en copón, por lo que el concepto que se estila en Madrid o León y por un buen precio, es muy recomendable con el pincho del día. Además es de bodega, por lo que para mi está riquísima. Por cierto, hay que tener muy en cuenta las sugerencias del día y su carta de bocadillos.

author: graham p
review_preview: Wanted a Spanish omelette for lunch and this was the third place in the same street as refused a table outside in two establishments with this game of all tables reserved which is not trueO Faro had a table at the end of the...
review_full: Wanted a Spanish omelette for lunch and this was the third place in the same street as refused a table outside in two establishments with this game of all tables reserved which is not true O Faro had a table at the end of the line of tables which a young waiter showed us to. No Q.R. to see the menu came with a menu after having asked for 2 beers just the menus. Told he was the only person for the tables so be patient. Ordered Spanish omelette and a salad. Both good but the time lapse was a wait and it was painful to see this waiter to and fro with no idea on how to serve tables. Quality price ratio good but the service zero. Your problem restaurant owner if you don't train your staff to be professional and not moan to customers.

author: Coastal503463
review_full: Perfecta para una comida informal en el centro de Ferrol. Tapas riquísimas, atención de diez y ubicación privilegiada, con terraza en una calle peatonal ancha, tranquila y sin aglomeroneraciones. Comimos de lujo y supercómodos.

author: chusgr
review_full: Local muy ameno, limpio, cuidado y elegante. El personal muy amable. Dispone de carta y de menú del día. Relación calidad precio muy buena. La comida muy sabrosa y bien preparada.

author: 320edu
review_full: Todo rico, con sabor a brasa, muy buena atención y rico chuleton, lo único negativo es esa parte en que te cobran por un chuleton lo que les da la gana ya que nadie te pesa el producto para que lo veas  Parece raro que todos los chuletones pesen igual

author: A2189PDantoniod
review_full: Visita obligada si estás en Ferrol. Siempre venimos cuando estamos aqui. Carnes, pescados de la zona, todo a la brasa. Carta amplia. Lugar acogedor, tranquilo con muy buena atención. Visita totalmente recomendable y con un precio contenido.

author: 237alexp
review_full: El sitio tiene un ambiente intimo y familiar, los pinchos riquísimos y muy buena variedad de vinos. Muy recomendable para pasar un rato agradable. El servicio excelente.

author: danielsG3607JA
review_full: Moi ben para tomar algo e tapear. Contan amén con boas opciones para comer e cear. Precios moi competitivos tanto nas racións como na selección de viños. Recomendable.

author: amatega
review_full: Sabemos que cuando vamos a un bar, normalmente nos ponen un pincho, hay veces que incluso te ponen unos cacahuetes resesos.  Pero es que esto es otro nivel, cada pincho que ponen cada día, es brutal

author: Windywest
review_preview: Call in for a late dinner with my daughter and was made welcome. The food is good and the service is friendly. OK maybe not haute cuisine but good fresh food cooked to order and tasty. Prices are reasonable and you can order half dishes...
review_full: Call in for a late dinner with my daughter and was made welcome. The food is good and the service is friendly. OK maybe not haute cuisine but good fresh food cooked to order and tasty. Prices are reasonable and you can order half dishes if you want a selection to share.  Certainly worth calling-in if in Ferrol.

author: BeKindToOneAnother18
review_preview: We were there with our friends and I was hoping to taste something fantastic but they just ordinary dishes. You can choke on potato fries if thats what you are after. LOL! The only thing I enjoyed was the fried peppers. Bill was a little...
review_full: We were there with our friends and I was hoping to taste something fantastic but they just ordinary dishes. You can choke on potato fries if thats what you are after. LOL! The only thing I enjoyed was the fried peppers. Bill was a little over 100 euros for 5 adults where we just shared 4 main meals.

author: taxKam
review_preview: 50% Potatoes 30% oil 20% puntas de calamarExpensive!!!!Lots of potatoes, all tapas were served in a base of fried potatoes
review_full: 50% Potatoes 30% oil 20% puntas de calamarExpensive!!!!Lots of potatoes, all tapas were served in a base of fried potatoes

author: Womblez
review_preview: Rather a 'fish and chip' place serving generous portions of freshly cooked fish as well as some meat dishes.The menu was partly in English and this suited some visitors to the town.Not too expensive and a busy site.
review_full: Rather a 'fish and chip' place serving generous portions of freshly cooked fish as well as some meat dishes.The menu was partly in English and this suited some visitors to the town.Not too expensive and a busy site.

author: 711chusn
review_full: Un lugar con encanto , excelente atención por parte del personal ,la carta es variada ,en mi visita además pude disfrutar de los pinchos ilustrados con motivo de la feria ilustrada y todos estaban deliciosos . Sitio muy recomendable si visitas Ferrol ,su ubicación en el barrio de la magdalena es ideal para disfrutar de ese bonito barrio de la ciudad.

author: Manu S
review_full: Local agradable, atención amable y comida estupenda! Probé sus pinchos ilustrados y además tienen historia. Una gran opción para comer en Ferrol.

author: guidoguiaturismo
review_full: Estiven na Taberna do Kraken a semana pasada despois dunha visita guiada por Ferrol, e a experiencia foi sinxelamente excepcional. Sentímonos como na casa, e degustamos especialidades históricas relacionadas co Ferrol da Ilustración. Un local con bo gusto e ganas de sumar!

author: brage2019
