author: Dave G
title_review: The best restaurant in northern Spain!
review_preview: I cannot praise this very special restaurant enough. Dont book unless you can spare the time to enjoy the best cuisine in northern Spain! We were in a group of 15 and the staff were attentive and supportive in suggesting different options. If you can,...
review_full: I cannot praise this very special restaurant enough. Dont book unless you can spare the time to enjoy the best cuisine in northern Spain! We were in a group of 15 and the staff were attentive and supportive in suggesting different options. If you can, have your tapas in the wine room then move to the main restaurant! Absolutely fantastic! First class fish and steaks! Steaks from regular 150g sirloin, fillets and for the hungry 750g T Bones all cooked to perfection! A great hidden gem!!

author: TravelerNYNy
title_review: Asian infusions with Galician roots: A Gabeira continues to make us dream!
review_preview: This Christmas we have been lucky enough to enjoy (yet!) another impressive dinner by Chef Miguel at A Gabeira. Despite arriving quite late, we were accommodated with a smile. As usual, we let Chef Miguel chose the menu.  First, we had crayfish (cigalas). The power...
review_full: This Christmas we have been lucky enough to enjoy (yet!) another impressive dinner by Chef Miguel at A Gabeira. Despite arriving quite late, we were accommodated with a smile.  As usual, we let Chef Miguel chose the menu. First, we had crayfish (cigalas). The power of this dish, its texture, the amazing flavor of the stock… kept us waiting for more. Next, pheasant dumplings. Having dined at some of the most prestigious Chinese restaurants in NYC, I must say that the texture of these dumplings was incredible… If I closed my eyes, I could see myself in Fung Tu in Chinatown! Well presented in a steamer, the inside was powerful and well complemented with the stock. Again, a perfect combination. Next the fish in a spicy Asian sauce… As expected, properly cooked (not overly raw or done), with the perfect combination of spices. To me, one of the best dishes. Finally, the meat. This time, Chef Miguel really surprised us by bringing the meat in hot stone plates, with wood-burning ashes in the middle. The smoky smell of the wood invaded the whole dining room in a very pleasant, cozy way… The texture, flavor and proportions of the meat (and accompanying sauces) were amazing.  In this occasion, I must say that the presentation of the different dishes was amazing, like little pieces of art, each one different, to impress us even more when we tasted them. We have seen this as a very welcomed turn in Chef Miguel’s style by projecting his creativity also into presentation and looks. Remaining faithful to his Galician roots, he has modernized the style, following the current culinary trends but, at the same time, infusing his very own way of thinking. Bravo, Miguel! As you can read, another excellent experience at A Gabeira: this time with Asian influences, an amazing presentation and a truly Galician substance. If you are a true gourmet and visit the area, you cannot miss A Gabeira. It will make you dream…

author: Yusticheff
review_full: Hacia tiempo q tenia ganas de ir a Serra ya que mucha gente me lo había recomendado.   La experiencia a sido magnífica, desde el entorno, la restauración de un antiguo aserradero a, por supuesto, la comida. Comimos las recomendaciones y fueron mas que acertadas, croquetas negras ( de chipiron ) tosta de chicharrón con queso de arzúa, callos hechos en horno de leña (la primera vez q como unos callos q me saben igual q los de mi madre, y para mi eso es la excelencia), carrilleras y rabo de ternera. Parece muchísimo ya que fue para dos, pero nos puso muy poco de cada para que pudiésemos probar muchas cosas. En pocos sitios lo hacen, y esto es gracias al magnifico dueño de este peculiar restaurante. Me alegro mucho de haberlo conocido, repetiré segurisimo, sobre todo cuando tienen el detalle de invitarnos a unos chupitos y unas cañas!! Muchas gracias por todo!!

author: Manuel D
review_full: Este restaurante, ubicado en Pedroso (Naron), es el consecuencia de la restauración de un viejo aserradero. Debo decir que el resultado ha sido magnifico. Cuenta a mayores, con un reservado para unas 20 personas, donde puedes disfrutar de una mas tranquila e intima comida. En el reservado se dispone de television y climatizador, ajustable por el cliente a su gusto. En cuanto a la comida, debo decir que fue satisfactoria, tanto en calidad, como en precio. Este ultimo realmente asequible. Entre sus entrantes destacan las croquetas y las tostas, ambas muy ricas. Luego también los callos al horno de leña y según temporada los cocidos. En resumen, una magnifica experiencia y muy recomendable. Para llegar a este lugar, dejo las coordenadas GPS: 43º32'19"N 8º06'50"W

author: malcolm-oap
review_preview: My wife and I recently visited Ferrol, a place we had never heard of before. It appears to be an undiscovered liitle town waiting to be discovered and developed. We strolled though the quiet streets and stumbled across a square. We made modest purchases in...
review_full: My wife and I recently visited Ferrol, a place we had never heard of before. It appears to be an undiscovered liitle town waiting to be discovered and developed.  We strolled though the quiet streets and stumbled across a square. We made modest purchases in the shops and called in a cafe where we were joined by friends. Our party had two beers and two white coffees, capucchinos don't seem to have reached here yet. We sat al fresco across the road from the cafe and the waitress had to serve all her customers by repeatedly crossing the road to serve us. The bill came to 6 euros 80, an indication that tourism hasn't caught up here yet! The experience was different but pleasant.

author: QUIMATO
review_full: Gracias a Tripadvisor, fuimos a comer a este restaurante y tengo que decir que la experiencia fue extraordinario, éramos 4 personas pedimos pulpo con langostinos, pimientos del padrón tortilla de patatas grande y ternera con patatas, todo estaba extraordinario, pedimos vino de la casa con la jarra helada muy bueno, el pan os lo podéis imaginar a un precio muy económico. Encontramos un sitio que reune las  3 B= Bueno, Bonito Barato. Por cierto la simpatía y amabilidad de la chica fue maravillosa. Os lo recomiendo al 100%.

author: Xusto1958
review_full: Fui a comer con mi mujer y salimos encantados por la calidad de la comida y la atenciòn del personal. Desde luego este restaurante hacer honor al pueblo de Redes. Bonito pueblo y magnifico restaurante.

author: 176leticiac
review_full: Somos clientes habituales desde que lo abrieron, y repetimos siempre que podemos en pareja, con familia o amigos porque la comida casera es espectacular, el trato de las gemelas y los camareros es inmejorable, son encantadores y el precio está muy bien. La tortilla de patata, las croquetas caseras, el pulpo con langostinos... buenísimo todo.

author: Lidia E
review_full: ¡Excelente! Recomendable visitar el Puerto de Reses y parar a comer en O Mourón das Gemelas. Un maravilloso trato y una comida casera estupenda. Recomendable no irse sin pedir el pulpo con langostinos, uno de sus platos Estrella.

author: silmanser
review_full: Al paso por Ares es de parada obligatoria. Comida casera de gran calidad. A destacar las croquetas de cecina, los espárragos, cualquiera de las carnes y mi favorito el pulpo con langostinos ( por encargo )

author: roberto r
review_full: Buen sitio para comer!!! Buenos productos Sitio acogedor Precios a la gallega....mu buenos !!!

author: 803josemanuela
review_full: Muy buena comida a precios asequible. Cenamos en la terraza ya que el local estaba totalmente reservado. El camarero que nos atendió muy educado y amable como el resto de trabajadores. La comida muy bien preparada. Con trabajadores así y los platos bien cocinados da gusto sentarse a la mesa.

author: CosmicStranger
review_preview: The place cooks sea food, fish, meat, and also very special hunted meat depending on season. Also has vegan food. The octopus which the call name Pulpo O Gallega is so good that you can’t even believe that you had eaten octopus before.The zamburinas...
review_full: The place cooks sea food, fish, meat, and also very special hunted meat depending on season. Also has vegan food. The octopus which the call name Pulpo O Gallega is so good that you can’t even believe that you had eaten octopus before. The zamburinas are another favorite. For meat unlimited choices are available. I preferred daily sea food and fish. Deserts are so rightly flavored no access sugar is included. Coffee is must. I had two. Enjoy the place and food. One of the highest tastes I don’t want to forget. The place is not in the populated are. You may need to take a taxi or drive. There’s a parking lot of the place. Wines are so fabulous you may drink more than you expect to. Make sure to have a reservation.

author: Bukky M
review_preview: Visited with my girlfriend for a nice meal out and was not disappointed! Steak was sensational, service was even better (despite us not speaking much Spanish and the waitress not speaking much English). Had a great evening, highly recommend.
review_full: Visited with my girlfriend for a nice meal out and was not disappointed! Steak was sensational, service was even better (despite us not speaking much Spanish and the waitress not speaking much English). Had a great evening, highly recommend.

author: Jóhannes S
review_preview: A fine restaurant to go for fancy dinner. Great steaks and fresh seafood. Very friendly staff and nice place in general.
review_full: A fine restaurant to go for fancy dinner. Great steaks and fresh seafood. Very friendly staff and nice place in general.

author: prewor
review_preview: Thursday 6th NovemberBased on the recommendation of a Spanish friend and also TripAdvisor reviews we went here expecting great things.  During our meal, we were the only 2 people in the restaurant and the meal got off to a good start with a complimentary...
review_full: Thursday 6th November Based on the recommendation of a Spanish friend and also TripAdvisor reviews we went here expecting great things. During our meal, we were the only 2 people in the restaurant and the meal got off to a good start with a complimentary soup of fish and potatoes which was excellent. From there things went down hill. My starter of mushroom risotto was very ordinary and much too big for a starter size. Main course was turbot which while very generous in its size was again nothing to write home about. My partner had crab lasagne to start which was hot on the outside but cold in the middle. This was followed by baked cod which was completely bland. None of the food was terrible and we had no problem with the quality of the ingredients, but for the prices being charged it was not acceptable. We had no issues with the service - the waiter was very helpful. To end a not great evening, as we were leaving, the chef, who admittedly was talking to some people who had just arrived, did not even have the courtesy to acknowledge us.

author: TravelerNYNy
title_review: Magnificent produce and avant garde techniques
review_preview: We had an impromptu celebration of our 10-year wedding anniversary and where else could it be more perfect than at A Gabeira? As we usually do, we let Chef Miguel surprise us… The menu was chosen by Miguel based on my fish preferences. With a...
review_full: We had an impromptu celebration of our 10-year wedding anniversary and where else could it be more perfect than at A Gabeira? As we usually do, we let Chef Miguel surprise us… The menu was chosen by Miguel based on my fish preferences. With a Galician flare, we started with bonito from Burela over a tomato salad… The bonito was beautifully cut, perfectly marinated, with a lovely texture. Miguel accompanied the bonito with a fabulous ginger ice cream on the side… It was refreshing and tasteful, reminding us of sushi makis, but with an unforgettable Galician root. Next came the berberechos (cockles) from San Felipe. Directly from the steamer, they were perfectly presented: the shells were spotless and sand-free and the berberechos conveniently removed, equal in size, a wave of flavor in each of them, a fantastic texture... After that, we enjoyed a squid salad which was presented flat. This time Chef Miguel played with different textures: the squid, the gelatin from the tomato heart… Mixing them with the different dressings was an experience all in itself. Unforgettable from beginning to end. Finally came a turbot which was uber perfect. While the flesh was superb and perfectly cooked, the mixture with paprika sauce was the perfect pairing for the white fish, what a surprise… While the portions were sufficient, perhaps with the intention to continue the experience, my husband still tried the filet mignon, which, as expected, was a pleasant surprise all by itself. Interestingly presented with a hollow potato filled with Galician melted cheese. The lovely A Coroa godello worked well with the sea-based menu that my husband ended with a wonderful glass of red for the filet mignon. Laughs, good company and a great celebration, consistent with Chef Miguel’s standards which are always high. A Gabeira is definitely one of the best restaurants in Galicia, worth every detour. Chef Miguel is faithful to its roots, using the best Galician produce and the most advanced culinary techniques. Always a pleasure to see how far the Galician cuisine can go. Thank you again, as always, Miguel.

author: TravelerNYNy
title_review: Amazing Autumn Menu - Chef Miguel was impressive once again!
review_preview: I am writing this review as a follow up from one I published a few years ago. Having returned to A Gabeira during my last trip to Spain, I was once again very impressed with the quality, atmosphere and professionalism of Chef Miguel and those...
review_full: I am writing this review as a follow up from one I published a few years ago. Having returned to A Gabeira during my last trip to Spain, I was once again very impressed with the quality, atmosphere and professionalism of Chef Miguel and those working at the restaurant. Being a party of four, we decided to go for the tasting menu. The quality, presentation, execution of the dishes were superb and exceeded even the most demanding expectations! The menu was primarily based on hunt and Autumn delicacies… We started with a delicious cream of lentejas (lentils), soft, velvety… The seafood in tempura that followed was crispy and amazingly well presented with Trompetas de la Muerte (Craterellus cornucopioides). The little filloas (crepes) filled with creamy mushrooms and surrounded by melted Galician cheese were to die for! The hake was perfectly cooked, with an amazing smoky flavor… This tasting menu was one of the most delicious I have ever tasted. Miguel, once again, we thank you for your expertise and for making these moments memorable! As customers, we cannot wait to see that Michelin star at your door! You truly deserve it!

author: Guisanotti
title_review: Beautiful place with amazing food and a perfect service.
review_preview: An amazing place. The restaurant is really beautiful both outside, in the terrace with views to the traditional style street, and inside. The service is really good, always friendly and providing a good atmosphere. The food is perfect and with a personal touch, as it's...
review_full: An amazing place. The restaurant is really beautiful both outside, in the terrace with views to the traditional style street, and inside. The service is really good, always friendly and providing a good atmosphere. The food is perfect and with a personal touch, as it's traditional Galician and Spanish food but with a nice different touch. The daily menu during week day lunch is cheap and just amazing, including a two course meal, dessert, drink and coffee. Totally recommend.

author: thesorrow87
review_preview: Really good tortilla and ham, we tasted a really nice wine called Carmelo Rodero and people is really nice there
review_full: Really good tortilla and ham, we tasted a really nice wine called Carmelo Rodero and people is really nice there

author: R4191EKjasonb
review_preview: We stopped in for a quick bite for lunch as we were walking around Ferrol, and it was a really nice surprise!  The wait staff was very nice, and talked were able to talk us through the menu in English, since our Spanish is only...
review_full: We stopped in for a quick bite for lunch as we were walking around Ferrol, and it was a really nice surprise! The wait staff was very nice, and talked were able to talk us through the menu in English, since our Spanish is only so-so. The sandwiches were terrific, and just the right size (and inexpensive) for a nice lunch. We also tried the amazing cod croquettes, which, as stated, were amazing!  What a nice, and inexpensive, lovely find for lunch!

author: mggarban
review_full: Encantados con este lugar , es ideal. Todo el personal amable y muy atento. La cocina genial, tanto para cenar , comer o tomar una bebida..siempre te acompañan con unos pinchos espectaculares. Lo mejor de Redes sin lugar a dudas.

author: unodegalicia
review_full: Visitamos este establecimiento por una recomendación que nos hicieron. La comida estupenda, terraza agradable y personal amable y eficiente. No se puede pedir mucho mas.  Se lo recomiendo a todo el mundo.

author: sarareija
review_full: Nos ha encantado el sitio. Hemos estado muy a gusto en la terraza. El albariño lo sirven en jarra de barro congelada y el de la casa es brutal. La comida impresionante calidad precio. Sin duda, repetiremos.

author: laura m
review_full: Un buen restaurante donde podrás comer variedad además te hacen sentir como en casa tanto Ceci cómo David como el resto de profesionales que componen la plantilla.Recomendado totalmente

author: ppuechs
review_full: Comida tradicional, típica de la zona, desde sardinas, pulpo, crocas, raxo etc caldos fresquitos gallegos para regar el paladar Servicio atento,rápido y agradable, local aceptable para un lugar de veraneo. volveremos,aconsejo reservar,está demandado

author: jurbra
review_full: Buen sitio de picoteo de comida casera. El Raxo, los chipirones, los calamares, la ensalada mixta a base de lechuga de la huerta, las croquetas, están fantásticos. Sitio rústico, sin pretensiones, servicio amable y eficaz y todo a precio razonable. En Ares sin duda un sitio recomendable. Conviene reservar ya que no tiene demasiadas mesas y es un sitio demandado.

author: Pitball2012
review_preview: After a very long day we decided to try this restaurant , opposite our hotel. Although 2200, we weren't the only ones there, in fact people came in after us, so nice atmosphere.  Very well prepared food. Warning , very generous proportions. Be hungry. Had...
review_full: After a very long day we decided to try this restaurant , opposite our hotel. Although 2200, we weren't the only ones there, in fact people came in after us, so nice atmosphere. Very well prepared food. Warning , very generous proportions. Be hungry. Had a very good bottle of wine. All in all a lovely meal for 88 euros.

author: PMLama
review_preview: I was surprised that in this small city there was such a good restaurant. The seafood was excellent and so was the service.
review_full: I was surprised that in this small city there was such a good restaurant. The seafood was excellent and so was the service.

author: TravelerNYNy
title_review: Excellent - Soon to be Michelin Star
review_preview: Excellent! Hidden gem!!! This is by far one of the most fabulous, better presented and most convincing restaurants in Galicia. Miguel, the chef, makes an excellent job in a creative cuisine that remains local. Ingredients are extremely fresh. Presentation is modern and classy. Taste is...
review_full: Excellent! Hidden gem!!! This is by far one of the most fabulous, better presented and most convincing restaurants in Galicia. Miguel, the chef, makes an excellent job in a creative cuisine that remains local. Ingredients are extremely fresh. Presentation is modern and classy. Taste is surprising and extremely comforting. The Galician cuisine at its heights in this restaurant. No surprise if it gets a Michelin star pretty soon as, compared with some perks, this restaurant is outstanding. Location is worth a detour. Thanks Miguel for making our visits so enjoyable. Strongly recommended!

author: diogoborges
review_preview: Everything we had was really good. Amazing eggs and veggie Mille-feuille. Made the whole dinner! the least impressive dish with the steak but sill a very good dinner all around.
review_full: Everything we had was really good. Amazing eggs and veggie Mille-feuille. Made the whole dinner! the least impressive dish with the steak but sill a very good dinner all around.

review_full: Un sitio acogedor,comimos muy bien,el trato por parte del personal un 10,atentos y rápidos. Unas buenas raciones,muy rico,pedimos carne rellena,ensalada,y fresas con nata , tarta helada y café. El pueblo donde esta este restaurante es Redes,pequeño,pero bonito de ver.

author: pgsf89
review_full: Siempre encantados de comer y cenar allí, el producto siempre de lo mejorcito, precios totalmente asequibles, raciones abundantes y la atención inmejorable. Yoli,David y Ceci son grandísimos profesionales y mejores personas. A seguir así familia.

author: marcopolo5000
review_full: A Ferradura es siempre una opción válida en Ares. El sitio es correcto, el servicio es amable, la comida es abundante y la calidad es correcta.

author: VERONICAOF1978
review_full: Un entrante de chipirones, y un rodaballo ralvaje espectacular para 2 del cual podrían comer 4... Una pieza con tamaño y sabor de 10. Las patatas fritas que acompañan a los platos riquísimas ( patata gallega frita en buen aceite)... Un buen vino blanco albariño, y nada más que decir... VOLVEREMOS!!! ✌✌✌✌

author: Nick M
review_preview: Very disappointed with food served. We think the chef wasn't at work when we visited as it seemed that another person took over in the kitchen later on in the evening. When we arrived about 21.00 hours there were staff only in the front area/cafe...
review_full: Very disappointed with food served. We think the chef wasn't at work when we visited as it seemed that another person took over in the kitchen later on in the evening. When we arrived about 21.00 hours there were staff only in the front area/cafe and when we were led around to the restaurant dining area at the back, the waitress had to switch on the lights whilst the male staff member put on an apron and went into the kitchen. The food was generally over cooked, which when you are paying good money for fresh fish, is not acceptable. As it was our first night and we were tired we didn't make a fuss but went meekly back to the hotel! For non-Spanish speakers the menu translation was basic, not great. Being January and perhaps a bit early in the evening too for dining, there was little ambience as we were the only customers.

author: paaller
review_preview: We visit this restaurant in July, Nice restaurant with excellent service. Our starter was a Fish soup that we never will forget. Fantastic. Our main dish was good too. Our most expensive meal in Ferrol but this was great value for the extra cost. We...
review_full: We visit this restaurant in July, Nice restaurant with excellent service. Our starter was a Fish soup that we never will forget. Fantastic. Our main dish was good too. Our most expensive meal in Ferrol but this was great value for the extra cost. We highly recommend this restaurant.

author: Mike220687
title_review: Best vinoteca/ wine bar in Ferrol
review_preview: Bacorino is without doubt the best vinoteca/wine bar in Ferrol.  It's just a short walk up Calle San Fransisco from the port, in an old stone built building.  If you want a wine selected by bodega, region, grape or specific taste then either Pablo or...
review_full: Bacorino is without doubt the best vinoteca/wine bar in Ferrol. It's just a short walk up Calle San Fransisco from the port, in an old stone built building. If you want a wine selected by bodega, region, grape or specific taste then either Pablo or Jose will choose a suitable wine for you. You will not be disappointed. To go with the wine, Belen makes a really good tortilla and there are delicious croquetas and embutidos as well. All in all, a nice friendly, comfortable and happy atmosphere. Try it and enjoy the experience.

author: J7021RNjohnf
review_preview: We were taken by Spanish friends to this busy but friendly establishment.It was a delightful experience bright clean with an interesting and different menu. A lovely Ribera de Duera - very reasonably priced an original salad and a selection of typical raciones gentlemen but...
review_full: We were taken by Spanish friends to this busy but friendly establishment. It was a delightful experience bright clean with an interesting and different menu. A lovely Ribera de Duera - very reasonably priced an original salad and a selection of typical raciones gentlemen but all with a small but positive gastronomic twist. We will revisit

author: Lizalooe
title_review: A surprisingly good restaurant on a slightly down at heel street
review_preview: We had selected Frank to eat at when researching Ferrol before our visit.  The street it is on, downhill from the Parador did not look very inspiring.  However Frank looked the smartest frontage.  We popped in to book for lunch the following day.  The lady...
review_full: We had selected Frank to eat at when researching Ferrol before our visit. The street it is on, downhill from the Parador did not look very inspiring. However Frank looked the smartest frontage. We popped in to book for lunch the following day. The lady we spoke to was very pleasant and helpful. Our lunch was extremely good and the prices very low for the quality of food. We shared 4 dishes, all very well prepared. The mussel paste with San Simon cheese was delicate and light. Stand out dish for us and mentioned in other reviews was langoustines in a crunchy coating, resembling angel hair pasta but I believe was made from filo pastry. Beautiful fresh langoustines perfectly cooked. There were about 15 savoury menu choices and about 5 puddings, a few specials listed on a board. Their wines also excellent and cheap. I had a very nice Albariño, €2.20 a glass and my husband a red, Ribera del Duero for €2.10. We left the restaurant feeling we had enjoyed interesting, excellently cooked food at remarkably low prices.

author: Nhiker
title_review: One of the best restaurants in Galicia, Spain
review_preview: Franks is  one of the best restaurants in Galicia.  Its menu is original and every dish is absolutely delicious.  The staff was courteous and helpful.
review_full: Franks is  one of the best restaurants in Galicia.  Its menu is original and every dish is absolutely delicious.  The staff was courteous and helpful.

author: Maria G
review_preview: We have been coming back to this restaurant every summer as it is really something else than what we have experienced in the area! The food is absolutely fantastic! Worth every penny. It is a small and popular restaurant so make sure you make a...
review_full: We have been coming back to this restaurant every summer as it is really something else than what we have experienced in the area! The food is absolutely fantastic! Worth every penny. It is a small and popular restaurant so make sure you make a reservation before showing up.

author: 567natid
review_full: Maravilloso. Es un imprescindible en Ferrol, una auténtica maravilla tanto la comida como el trato. Recomendable al 100%.
